posts.name: Harold Griswold
posts.cooked: When attempting to run the latest FRC Radio Utility we keep getting the following error. A JNI error has occurred, please check your installation and try again We’ve narrowed it down to the utility being compiled by a more recent version of Java Runtime but the latest Java 8 update isn’t recent enough. Even removing java and reinstalling it has yet to work. Is there a step we are missing in installing the utility?

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: I believe it was (accidentally?) built against the Java 11 target, so you would need to use that.  I believe it should use the WPILib JDK if it exists, or you could install it manually.  I’m not sure if they’re planning to release a new version with that fixed since Java 8 is supposed to be supported

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: Fletch is correct. Because of a configuration error Java 11 is actually the minimum required. You can either get that from OpenJDK, or if you install 2022 wpilib the tool will pick it up.

posts.name: Joseph Brescia
posts.cooked: Good Afternoon, My team uses LabView and we get the same error when trying to open Radio Utility. How would we fix this?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Either install WPILib 2022 ( github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/releases ) or install OpenJDK 11 or newer ( adoptium.net ).

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
